lines.text: You will not take action without authorization.
What do you think I am, some gung-ho, stupid son of a bitch?
No, I don't think you're stupid. I think you're a talented soldier with sloppy impulse control.
they demand power, and respect, and they're willing to pay top dollar to get it. And that is our highly motivated buyer.
What about other motivations?
Not important to me.

Whether it's important to you or not, there are people out there who don't care about money, who don't give a damn about respect. People who believe the killing of innocent men and women is justified. For them it is about rage, frustration, hatred... they feel pain and they're determined to share it with the world.
Okay, that does me no good. Now let's deal with the facts at hand. 23 hours ago, General Alexander Kodoroff stole ten nuclear warheads.
He's just a delivery boy. I'm not afraid of the man who wants ten nuclear weapons, Colonel. I'm terrified of the man who only wants one.
Where the hell is my military liason?
Colonel Thomas Devoe reporting as ordered, ma'am. I'm sorry about in there, sometimes my enthusiasm gets the better of me.
No problem. Would you like some coffee?
I'd love some.
It's over there.

[approaching enemy truck in a helo]
All right, gentlemen - whatever you do, do not shoot any civilians, do you understand?
[minutes later, pointing to a couple of gunmen on the bridge below]
Those fuckers you can shoot!
[after Devoe introduces Julia]
[to Devoe, in Russian]
A beautiful woman, and a PhD. You're way out of your league.

[in Russian]
You have no idea, Colonel.
Colonel, the guy you bagged is Dr. Amir Teraki, Pakistani. PhD in Astrophysics, educated at Harvard.
That's right, people. We educated half the world's terrorists.
So do you think he set us up?
Who?
Your friend.
No.
How can you be so sure?
Because he's my friend.

[Devoe wants to take a team into Russia while they know where the bombs are]
The Russians say they are handling it.
The Russians couldn't find snow in the middle of fucking winter. Look, it's this simple. When that satellite is out of range, those nukes are gone.
[pause]
It's only jet fuel.

a war waged by our own leaders. And who supplied the Serb cluster bombs, the Croatian tanks, the Muslim artillery shells that killed our sons and daughters? It was the governments of the West who drew the boundaries of our countries - sometimes in ink, sometimes in blood - the blood of our people. And now you dispatch your peacekeepers to write our destiny again. We can never accept this peace that leaves us with nothing but pain, pain the peacemakers must be made to feel. Their wives, their children, their houses and churches. So now you know, now you must understand. Leave us to find our own destiny. May God have mercy on us all.
which is it going to be?
Well, I believe this week we're saving it.
Russia, what a fucking mess! God, I miss the cold war.
Would you call Langley? We're still waiting on a psych profile on Kodorov.
He's an asshole. Save you the trip.
Thanks, I'll settle for the official version.
OK, officially - he's an asshole!
I'm not gonna shoot you unless I have to. And if I have to I'll feel really bad about it. Now sit down!

[Devoe phones Kodoroff, who is driving a truck loaded with stolen nuclear warheads]
You watched CNN during Desert Storm. You remember all those television shots from the nose cone of the GBU missiles slammin' into those trucks? Remember that picture? How it kept gettin' closer and bigger on the screen... You'd just about see the faces of those drivers and then... Zap! The picture went dead, we didn't get to see what happened next. Well guess what, Alek? You will.
It doesn't make sense. You don't... you don't kill a Dimitri Vertikoff. There are certain rules - killing him isn't useful.
Is it ever?
Sir, it's not our war.
It is now!
[He raises his gun to his head... ]
NO-!
[... and shoots himself]
Fuckin' refugees. Azerbaijani, Georgians, Kazakhstani...
Well, don't curse them.
I don't care whose bitch gave birth to them. Muslim, Serb. I don't hate them for who they are, I hate them because they are poor.

[Julia Kelly is trying to disarm a nuclear bomb with less than a minute left while Tom Devoe is standing next to her]
Devoe, get out of here.

[laughs]
Okay, I'll be in the truck.

My personal agenda is my business. Now you are not in Washington anymore. You are in the real world, and in the real world there are nuclear arms heading for Iran. Now whether your agree with me or not, GET ME AUTHORIZED!

[agent gets in driver's seat]
Where are you from?
Philadelphia.

[disdainful]
... Give me the keys.
I don't know about these guys, but General Aleksandr Kodoroff doesn't ride around on a nuclear transportation train. It's like Ivana Trump on the subway.

[Devoe is holding the passenger list of the train]
Forty men on board.
Well, this is meaningless.
It's in Russian.

[in Russian]
It's meaningless because they haven't listed anybody's rank.
Urinalysis from a Moscow traffic stop last month, .367.
I'm amazed he could turn the key.
Yeah, that's definitely a few cocktails.

[after questioning the banker fails, Devoe ties him up and interrogates him at gunpoint]
This is your plan?
This is my plan.

[incredulous]
This is your *fucking* plan?
Yep, this is my plan.
Music should flow like a language. Changing a single note can turn joy to sorrow.

[to Devoe and Julia]
Who decided that my wife... MY CHILD! should have to die? And for what? FOR WHAT? Who decides for me?
[Dr. Taraki finishes disassembling one of the stolen warheards]
It can be activated by a single man, and should deliver a nuclear yield of between one and two kilotons.
Why is he doing that now?
one warhead for us, to do with as we wished.

[holds his gun under Vlado's chin]
*After* I get my money.
[Storming into Dusan's hotel room, they find him gone, and Julia opens the box he used to transport the nuclear weapon]
"Diplomatic papers." They never even searched it!
[Losungsswort]
I need the password... What's the password?
Hang on...
[rips duct tape and ask Hans]
Password
NO

[to Julia]
All right... Hang on...
[puts silencer on his gun and puts it on Hans left elbow]
All right, Hans, we'll do it your way... How's the backhand? Password
Hasselhoff

[to Julia]
Hasselhoff
Hasselhoff - how do you spell Hasselhoff?
We have a survivor here, sir.

[to man hanging off side of bridge]
Do you speak English?
Yes - I went to Harvard - Go Crimson! Help me up, please?
Somebody set that nuclear weapon off.
